Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2017 08:19PM DebbieNinja wrote: I have the same pain, only mine radiates around to my back on both sides (right and left). My plastic surgeon says that is is nerve damage (neuropathy) from the surgeries. It does feel like a stabbing pain. There are medications that you can take to help with this type of pain. I was originally on gabapentin for nearly 3 years before I was switched to Lyrica. Check with your plastic surgeon. This is a common occurrence after multiple surgeries.
Posts.Title: Nerve pain that won't dissipitate luckykitkat09 DebbieNinja

Posts.Content: DebbieNinja wrote: I had my final Taxol treatment on Feb14th of this year.  I had significant neuropathy in my hands and my feet throughout the treatment.  My hands have returned to normal.  The neuropathy in feet, for the most part, has gone away except for my toes and the part of my foot right below my toes.  It has been 7 months since I finished treatment.  I am wondering how long it is going to take for the neuropathy to completely go away.  DebbieNinja...cancer warrier Dx 8/17/2012, ILC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 9/5/2012 Mastectomy: Left, Right Surgery 9/5/2012 Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Chemotherapy 10/3/2012 AC Chemotherapy 12/4/2012 Taxol (paclitaxel) Hormonal Therapy 2/20/2013 Hormonal Therapy 10/8/2013 Aromasin (exemestane) Surgery 10/8/2013 Prophylactic ovary removal Surgery 12/9/2014 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery Reconstruction (right): Silicone implant Surgery Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right): Silicone implant Log in to post a reply
